intro: Diceros caespitosus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and produces showy, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other familiar flowering plants. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Diceros caespitosus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is used in both garden landscapes and traditional medicine.
